<!DOCTYPE html><html lang="en"><script id="gtm">
          performance.mark('gtm.start');
          (function (w, d, s, l, i) {
            w[l] = w[l] || [];
            w[l].push({ 'gtm.start': new Date().getTime(), event: 'gtm.js' });
            var f = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0],
                j = d.createElement(s),
                dl = l != 'dataLayer' ? '&l=' + l : '';
            j.async = true;
            j.src = 'https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtm.js?id=' + i + dl;
            j.onload = function () {
              performance.mark('gtm.end');
              performance.measure('gtm', 'gtm.start', 'gtm.end');
            };
            f.parentNode.insertBefore(j, f);
        })(window, document, 'script', 'dataLayer', 'GTM-M36RG8PT');
        </script><head><meta charSet="utf-8"/><meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width"/><link rel="shortcut icon" href="https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/favicon.7bc3d920.ico"/><script>
      try {
        window.eventsToSend = window.eventsToSend || []
        window.eventsToSend.push({
          name: "page_rendering",
          timestamp: new Date().toISOString(),
          value: JSON.stringify({
            time: performance?.now()
          })
        })
      } catch (error) {
        console.error("Failed to push page render event:", error)
      }

class="metadata Metadata_root__EZem9" data-cy="metadata"><h1 class="title Metadata_title__aM3nZ Heading_h1__jLBB4 Heading_heading___M8rU">Hi-Tech Crime Trends 2016</h1><div class="stats Stats_root__p_BoZ"><time dateTime="2017-03-30 16:21:02 UTC">Mar 30, 2017</time><span class="Stats_bullet__DbT30"></span><span class="text Text_root__RtCPC Text_medium__TH6gG Text_secondary__o6d_E Likes_root__WVQ1_" style="-webkit-line-clamp:0" tabindex="0">2 likes</span><span class="Stats_bullet__DbT30"></span><span class="text Text_root__RtCPC Text_medium__TH6gG Text_secondary__o6d_E Likes_root__WVQ1_" style="-webkit-line-clamp:0" tabindex="0">1,002<!-- --> <!-- -->views</span><button type="button" class="ai-tag unstyled-button AITag_tag__Xx37c" data-cy="ai-tag" aria-describedby="aiTag-description" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R3497d6:" popovertarget=":R3497d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R3497d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:20px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/sparkle.f6b6d540.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span>AI-enhanced description</button><div class="" id=":R3497d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R3497d6"></div></div><div class="author Author_root___6Bx5"><a data-cy="author-link" class="Author_link___lVxw ellipsis" title="Group-IB" href="https://www.slideshare.net/Group-IB"><div class="Avatar_root__GNWHY" style="width:24px;height:24px;line-height:24px"><img class="Avatar_image__Bbtll" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/profile-photo-Group-IB-48x48.jpg?cb=1523415001" alt="Group-IB" loading="lazy" decoding="sync"/></div><span>Group-IB</span></a></div><div class="description Description_root__kt4uq Description_clamped__PaV_1"><div class="Description_wrapper__hYE9_"><p data-cy="document-description">The document reviews hi-tech crime trends from Q2 2015 to Q1 2016, focusing on the rise of targeted attacks on banks, the expansion of the Android trojan market, and the increasing threat of ransomware and attacks on critical infrastructure. It highlights key developments in the Russian cybercrime market, including the emergence of new trojans and sophisticated attack strategies leveraging social engineering. The report concludes with recommendations for prevention and response measures against these evolving cyber threats.</p><div class="pills-list PillsList_root__2EydN"><a class="Pill_root__IqOYH" aria-label="View the featured presentations, documents and infographics in the Technology Category" href="https://www.slideshare.net/category/technology"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/technology.d591b5b1.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span>Technology</a></div></div><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_primary__K25Gq Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Description_more__ChrRK" TARGETED ATTACKS ON BANKS
CHANGE IN
FOCUS
Active groups
specializing in attacks
on companies will
threaten banks
EXPANDING IN
GEOGRAPHY
Hackers attacking Russian
banks will move their
activity to other regions
worldwide
BROADENING
COMPETENCIES
Groups attacking ATMs will
perform cyber thefts on
SWIFT system
PHISHING
MAILOUTS
The key vector to infect
banking networks is
phishing emails
INVOLVING
INSIDERS
Hackers devote more
time searching for
insiders (contacts,
application launch,
consulting on system
operation)
LEGITIMATE
TOOLS
Criminals choose
legitimate or free tools to
perform attacks
Arrests of Russian-speaking hacker groups
have a significant impact on
the global landscape of banking threats
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM

Russian-speaking PC Trojan developers take
over the world
CONTRACTION OF
THE RUSSIAN
MARKET
The amount of groups,
Trojans and losses from
attacks will continuously
decrease
MOVEMENT TO
NEW MARKETS
New Trojans designed
to attack foreign banks
will be actively
developed
HACKERS TO
SELL ACTIVE
BOTNETS
Some active botnets will be
sold to less-experienced
perpetrators
WEB INJECTS
Developers will add web
injects to perform
automated attacks
FAKE WEB PAGES
Fake web pages added to
Trojans will enable hackers
to expand the list of
attacked countries
SPAM MAILOUTS
The key infection vector
for banking Trojans

a BOOM in banking Trojans targeting Android
Thefts from
companies
Trojans to be adjusted
to steal money from
legal entities
Covert infection
Specialized exploit kits for
Android will be released
Sophisticated
functionality
Advanced Trojans will enable
hackers to implement all
attack schemes that were
successfully performed on
PC.
Losses from attacks using
Android Trojans will
exceed damages from PC
Trojans – THE MOST
DANGEROUS THREAT
to BANKS
Mobile web injects
Services for writing injects
for mobile browsers will be
offered on underground
forums; Trojans will widely
support web injects
Increased
damage
Average loss will
increase due to
targeted attacks on
companies
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM

Active automated
manipulations
Passive automated
manipulations
All new Trojans
support automated
manipulations
PHISHING
Bypassing SMS
verification using
dialog windows
ON ANDROID
Automated transfer via
SMS banking
Automated transfer
between cards
VISHING
Bypassing SMS
verification using IVR
TREND NO.5
COMPLETELY AUTOMATED FRAUD
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 " class="vertical-slide-image VerticalSlideImage_image__VtE4p" data-testid="vertical-slide-image" fetchpriority="auto" loading="lazy" srcSet="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/gib-en-170330162103/85/Hi-Tech-Crime-Trends-2016-12-320.jpg 320w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/gib-en-170330162103/85/Hi-Tech-Crime-Trends-2016-12-638.jpg 638w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/gib-en-170330162103/75/Hi-Tech-Crime-Trends-2016-12-2048.jpg 2048w" src="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/gib-en-170330162103/85/Hi-Tech-Crime-Trends-2016-12-320.jpg" sizes="100vw"/></div><!--$--><!--/$--></div></div><div><div id="slide13" class="VerticalSlide_root__jU_9r slide-item" style="aspect-ratio:1024 / 768" data-cy="slide-container"><div class="VerticalSlideImage_root__64KSA"><img id="slide-image-12" alt="FORECAST
AUTOMATED FRAUD
Automatic fraud on
ANDROID
Criminals will attack both
companies and people
using web injects to
replace payment details.
ROBOT-BASED
VISHING
Automated vishing attacks
will be adjusted to bypass
SMS verification and will
become more popular
AUTOMATED
PHISHING
The function to bypass
SMS verification will make
mobile Trojans the most
dangerous threat to the
majority of banks.
With their wide distribution and automation
PHISHING and ANDROID Trojans will finally replace PC
Trojans.
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 " class="vertical-slide-image VerticalSlideImage_image__VtE4p" data-testid="vertical-slide-image" fetchpriority="auto" loading="lazy" srcSet="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/gib-en-170330162103/85/Hi-Tech-Crime-Trends-2016-13-320.jpg 320w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/gib-en-170330162103/85/Hi-Tech-Crime-Trends-2016-13-638.jpg 638w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/gib-en-170330162103/75/Hi-Tech-Crime-Trends-2016-13-2048.jpg 2048w" src="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/gib-en-170330162103/85/Hi-Tech-Crime-Trends-2016-13-320.jpg" sizes="100vw"/></div><!--$--><!--/$--></div></div><div><div id="slide14" class="VerticalSlide_root__jU_9r slide-item" style="aspect-ratio:1024 / 768" data-cy="slide-container"><div class="VerticalSlideImage_root__64KSA"><img id="slide-image-13" alt="TREND NO.6
IOT TRIGGERS THE GROWTH OF
BOTNETS FOR DDOS ATTACKS
MOVE AWAY
AMPLIFIERS
DNS, NTP, SSDP,
CharGen and other types
are less actively used
BOTNETS
REAPPEAR
Criminals often use Linux
servers and simple IoT
devices to create botnets
SOURCE CODES
ARE PUBLISHED
Lizard Stresser and Mirai
were released publicly
Dynamic IP addresses
No antivirus installed
24-hours access to the Internet
IoT devices are perfect bots
Difficult to update and eliminate
known vulnerabilities
Passwords set by default
2015
450 Gbps
2016
602 Gbps
09.2016
1 Tbps
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 " class="vertical-slide-image VerticalSlideImage_image__VtE4p" data-testid="vertical-slide-image" fetchpriority="auto" loading="lazy" srcSet="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/gib-en-170330162103/85/Hi-Tech-Crime-Trends-2016-14-320.jpg 320w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/gib-en-170330162103/85/Hi-Tech-Crime-Trends-2016-14-638.jpg 638w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/gib-en-170330162103/75/Hi-Tech-Crime-Trends-2016-14-2048.jpg 2048w" src="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/gib-en-170330162103/85/Hi-Tech-Crime-Trends-2016-14-320.jpg" sizes="100vw"/></div><!--$--><!--/$--></div></div><div><div id="slide15" class="VerticalSlide_root__jU_9r slide-item" style="aspect-ratio:1024 / 768" data-cy="slide-container"><div class="VerticalSlideImage_root__64KSA"><img id="slide-image-14" alt="TREND NO.7
Ransomware – snowballing threat
Key target – enterprises
Buy access to critical data
Check servers by guessing their
passwords
Encrypt Windows and Linux-based
servers
A wide variety of attacks
on mobile devices and IoT
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 " class="vertical-slide-image VerticalSlideImage_image__VtE4p" data-testid="vertical-slide-image" fetchpriority="auto" loading="lazy" srcSet="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/gib-en-170330162103/85/Hi-Tech-Crime-Trends-2016-15-320.jpg 320w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/gib-en-170330162103/85/Hi-Tech-Crime-Trends-2016-15-638.jpg 638w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/gib-en-170330162103/75/Hi-Tech-Crime-Trends-2016-15-2048.jpg 2048w" src="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/gib-en-170330162103/85/Hi-Tech-Crime-Trends-2016-15-320.jpg" sizes="100vw"/></div><!--$--><!--/$--></div></div><div><div id="slide16" class="VerticalSlide_root__jU_9r slide-item" style="aspect-ratio:1024 / 768" data-cy="slide-container"><div class="VerticalSlideImage_root__64KSA"><img id="slide-image-15" alt="FORECAST
INCREASE IN INCIDENTS WITH RANSOMWARE
Wide variety of
targets
Mobile and IoT devices,
cloud storages
Average ransom will
increase
Newer ransomware versions
will deliberately target key
business assets, which will
significantly raise the price of
ransomware decryption keys
Pinpoint attack
The key target is companies
with critical business
processes, which cannot
spend time to recover them
and will pay ransoms
Worms
Ransomware will be
distributed as
cryptoworms to widely
spread threats and
cause significant
damage
Smoke Screens
Encrypting ransomware will
be used as a “distraction”
tool in conjunction with high-
profile targeted attacks, like
DDoS attacks used
previously
An increase in attacks will
stimulate the cyber risk
insurance segment, which in
turn will motivate criminals
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM

OPERATOR LEVEL

license for one of the

Defentek, Verint,
CleverSig, Circles,
Cobham
Using Android Trojans

NEW TOOLS FOR TARGETED ATTACKS
AND ESPIONAGE
What hackers obtain:
Access to all the
traffic
Ability to decrypt
SSL
Access to
credentials of
external systems
What hackers obtain:
Access to geo-location
Voice interception
SMS interception
Access to messengers,
photos, and files

commands
Password recovery
Access to a cloud storage
At provider level
What hackers need:
Access to a routing
gateway or their own
autonomous system
(AS)
What hackers obtain:
Access to geo-
location
Voice interception
SMS interception

commands

ATTACKS ON CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE
Public
information
Information on
successful attacks will
leak to journalists
because of their
political subtext
Popularization
Public reaction to
successful attacks will
provoke increased interest
from cyber-armies and
terrorists
Cyber-armies
Cyber-armies will attack
critical infrastructure
facilities
Goal: espionage and
control capability
Terrorists
Cyber-terrorists will
target critical
infrastructure facilities
Goal: public attention,
human losses
ONLINE
RECRUITMENT
Cyber-terrorists will
actively use the Internet
for propagation and
recruitments of technical
specialists, who are able
to perform targeted
attacks
arrests
and recruitment
Hackers arrested for
targeted attacks on
companies will be
recruited by the
Government
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM

class="sr-only"></span></span>Hi-Tech Crime Trends 2016</h2><div><ul class="Transcript_list__faItj"><div><li>1. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#1">2015 Q2 –
2016 </a> Q1
HI-TECH
CRIME TRENDS
2016
 </li></div><div><li>2. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#2">Review of the </a> Russian cybercrime market
Key driver of growth – Targeted attacks
Changes to previous period
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>3. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#3">TREND No.1
TARGETED ATTACKS </a> ON BANKS AS A GLOBAL THREAT
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>4. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#4">COBALT
ATMs and SWIFT
TREND </a> NO.2
GROUPS REFOCUS FROM COMPANIES TO BANKS
LURK
Core Banking Systems
CORKOW
POS terminals, ATMs,
trading terminals
ANUNAK
Core Banking Systems,
SWIFT, ATMs,
payment gateways,
POS terminals
BUHTRAP
Core Banking Systems
GROUP-IB.COM/REPORTS
CURRENT
soon!
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>5. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#5">FORECAST
TARGETED ATTACKS ON </a> BANKS
CHANGE IN
FOCUS
Active groups
specializing in attacks
on companies will
threaten banks
EXPANDING IN
GEOGRAPHY
Hackers attacking Russian
banks will move their
activity to other regions
worldwide
BROADENING
COMPETENCIES
Groups attacking ATMs will
perform cyber thefts on
SWIFT system
PHISHING
MAILOUTS
The key vector to infect
banking networks is
phishing emails
INVOLVING
INSIDERS
Hackers devote more
time searching for
insiders (contacts,
application launch,
consulting on system
operation)
LEGITIMATE
TOOLS
Criminals choose
legitimate or free tools to
perform attacks
Arrests of Russian-speaking hacker groups
have a significant impact on
the global landscape of banking threats
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>6. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#6">TREND NO.3
Russian-speaking PC </a> Trojan
developers take over the world
GLOBE
Panda Banker (new)
Shifu (new)
Midas bot (Jupiter) (new)
GozNym (new)
Sphinx (new)
Corebot (new)
Atmos (new)
Gozi (ISFB)
Dridex
Qadars
Gootkit
Vawtrak
Tinba
KINS (ZeusVM)
Citadel
Zeus
Quakbot (Qbot)
Retefe
Ramnit
RUSSIA
Buhtrap
Toplel
Ranbyus
RTM (new)
Jupiter (new)
Lurk
Corkow
Yebot
Kronos
Chtonic
16 of the 19 Trojans that have been actively used to
attack companies are believed to be developed by
Russian-speaking cybercriminals
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>7. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#7">FORECAST
Russian-speaking PC Trojan </a> developers take
over the world
CONTRACTION OF
THE RUSSIAN
MARKET
The amount of groups,
Trojans and losses from
attacks will continuously
decrease
MOVEMENT TO
NEW MARKETS
New Trojans designed
to attack foreign banks
will be actively
developed
HACKERS TO
SELL ACTIVE
BOTNETS
Some active botnets will be
sold to less-experienced
perpetrators
WEB INJECTS
Developers will add web
injects to perform
automated attacks
FAKE WEB PAGES
Fake web pages added to
Trojans will enable hackers
to expand the list of
attacked countries
SPAM MAILOUTS
The key infection vector
for banking Trojans
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM

a BOOM in </a> banking Trojans targeting Android
Thefts from
companies

to steal money from
legal entities
Covert infection
Specialized exploit kits for
Android will be released
Sophisticated
functionality

hackers to implement all
attack schemes that were
successfully performed on
PC.
Losses from attacks using
Android Trojans will
exceed damages from PC
Trojans – THE MOST
DANGEROUS THREAT
to BANKS

for mobile browsers will be

support web injects

damage

increase due to
targeted attacks on
companies
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>12. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#12">ON PC
Active automated
manipulations
Passive </a> automated
manipulations
All new Trojans
support automated
manipulations
PHISHING
Bypassing SMS
verification using
dialog windows
ON ANDROID
Automated transfer via
SMS banking
Automated transfer
between cards
VISHING
Bypassing SMS
verification using IVR
TREND NO.5
COMPLETELY AUTOMATED FRAUD
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>13. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#13">FORECAST
AUTOMATED FRAUD
Automatic fraud </a> on
ANDROID
Criminals will attack both
companies and people
using web injects to
replace payment details.
ROBOT-BASED
VISHING
Automated vishing attacks
will be adjusted to bypass
SMS verification and will
become more popular
AUTOMATED
PHISHING
The function to bypass
SMS verification will make
mobile Trojans the most
dangerous threat to the
majority of banks.
With their wide distribution and automation
PHISHING and ANDROID Trojans will finally replace PC
Trojans.
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>14. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#14">TREND NO.6
IOT TRIGGERS </a> THE GROWTH OF
BOTNETS FOR DDOS ATTACKS
MOVE AWAY
AMPLIFIERS
DNS, NTP, SSDP,
CharGen and other types
are less actively used
BOTNETS
REAPPEAR
Criminals often use Linux
servers and simple IoT
devices to create botnets
SOURCE CODES
ARE PUBLISHED
Lizard Stresser and Mirai
were released publicly
Dynamic IP addresses
No antivirus installed
24-hours access to the Internet
IoT devices are perfect bots
Difficult to update and eliminate
known vulnerabilities
Passwords set by default
2015
450 Gbps
2016
602 Gbps
09.2016
1 Tbps
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>15. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#15">TREND NO.7
Ransomware – </a> snowballing threat
Key target – enterprises
Buy access to critical data
Check servers by guessing their
passwords
Encrypt Windows and Linux-based
servers
A wide variety of attacks
on mobile devices and IoT
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>16. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#16">FORECAST
INCREASE IN INCIDENTS </a> WITH RANSOMWARE
Wide variety of
targets
Mobile and IoT devices,
cloud storages
Average ransom will
increase
Newer ransomware versions
will deliberately target key
business assets, which will
significantly raise the price of
ransomware decryption keys
Pinpoint attack
The key target is companies
with critical business
processes, which cannot
spend time to recover them
and will pay ransoms
Worms
Ransomware will be
distributed as
cryptoworms to widely
spread threats and
cause significant
damage
Smoke Screens
Encrypting ransomware will
be used as a “distraction”
tool in conjunction with high-
profile targeted attacks, like
DDoS attacks used
previously
An increase in attacks will
stimulate the cyber risk
insurance segment, which in
turn will motivate criminals
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>17. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#17">TREND NO.8

on critical infrastructure

location

SMS interception

commands

information

successful attacks will
leak to journalists

terrorists

critical infrastructure
facilities

control capability
Terrorists

target critical
infrastructure facilities

human losses

RECRUITMENT

actively use the Internet
for propagation and

specialists, who are able
to perform targeted
attacks
arrests
and recruitment

companies will be

Government

The report concludes with recommendations for prevention and response measures against these evolving cyber It finds that over 40% of reported attacks were aimed at stealing sensitive personal information, likely for profit. Additionally, around 23% of incidents involved website defacement, with about half of those being for political messages. In general, around 67% of attacks appeared aimed at financial gain through theft of data, planting malware, or spam. I've also been teaching product management to ensure my students save time and money to get to the same level as me faster avoiding popular mistakes. Self-driving cars, video calls and smart TV, personalized ads and identity scanning. Sci-fi movies and books gave us many ideas and some are being implemented as we speak. Instead of waiting to see what the government and billionaires come up with, I say we should design our own future. \n\nSo, we as humans, when we don’t know something - fear takes over. The same thing happened during the industrial revolution. In the Industrial Era, machines didn’t steal jobs—they transformed them but people were scared about their jobs. The AI era is making similar changes except it feels like robots will take the center stage instead of a human.
